Query: How to get a response from any URL?

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Download a file, saving the output under the filename indicated by the URL
Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_178719: Getting the redirection URL of a phishing
so_21888831: Get JSON value from URL in BASH
so_7678675: Get cURL response in bash
Top-3 Scripts:
so_21888831: value=$(
  curl -s "$url" |
  ruby -rjson -e 'data = JSON.parse(STDIN.read); puts data["latest"]["snapshot"]'
)

Explanations about Options.-T:
This transfers the specified local file to the remote URL. If there is no file part
 in the specified URL, curl will append the local file name. NOTE that you must use
 a trailing / on the last directory to really prove to Curl that there is no file
 name or curl will think that your last directory name is the remote file name to
 use. That will most likely cause the upload operation to fail. If this is used on
 an HTTP(S) server, the PUT command will be used.
Explanations about Options.-s:
Silent or quiet mode. Don't show progress meter or error messages. Makes Curl
 mute. It will still output the data you ask for, potentially even to the
 terminal/stdout unless you redirect it.

ul_133904: urls=$(wget -q -O - -i urllist.txt | grep -oi "http://vimeo.com/[0-9]\+")
for url in $urls; do
  echo "Downloading [$url]"
  vimeo_downloader.sh "$url"
done

ul_347732: $ export FOO=http://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/ask
$ tmp="${FOO#*//}" # remove http://
$ echo "${tmp%%/*}" # remove everything after the first /
unix.stackexchange.com

$ echo "$FOO" | python -c 'import urlparse; import sys;  print urlparse.urlparse(sys.stdin.read()).netloc' 
unix.stackexchange.com

au_887234: printf "\n# CurrentSession:\n"; \
cat $HOME/.mozilla/firefox/*.default/sessionstore-backups/recovery.js | \
sed "s/\\_closedTabs/\{\"url\":\"# ClosedTabs:\"attributes/g" | \
sed "s/\\lastSessionState/\{\"url\":\"# LastSession:\"attributes/" | \
sed "s/{/\n{/g" | \
egrep -o 'url":"*.*attributes*' | \
cut -d\" -f3 | \
sed "s/#/\n#/" \
; echo

; echo

printf "\n# CurrentSession:\n"; \
cat $HOME/.mozilla/firefox/*.default/sessionstore-backups/recovery.js | \
sed "s/\\_closedTabs/\{\"url\":\"# ClosedTabs:/g" | \
sed "s/\\lastSessionState/\{\"url\":\"# LastSession:/" | \
sed "s/entries/url\":\"# TAB:/g" | \
sed "s/{/\n{/g" | \
egrep 'url":"*' | \
cut -d\" -f4 | \
sed "s/#/\n#/" \
; echo
